sentences.text: So hello everyone, I am Vik Shant, so today we will be learning about yes, Oops object oriented programming.

improvement.reason: The introduction to OOP is a bit abrupt; it would benefit from a brief, high-level definition of what Object-Oriented Programming is.
improvement.suggestion: Hello everyone, I am Vik Shant, and today we will be learning about OOP, or Object-Oriented Programming, which is a powerful programming paradigm based on the concept of 'objects' that can contain data and code.

sentences.text: We will take a real simple example of a coffee machine and we will see. So think of the coffee machine as a class, it is like a blueprint, it defines the functions of a coffee machine like making a coffee, making a cappuccino, Allah Teh etc.

improvement.reason: Transcription error: 'Allah Teh' should be 'latte'. 'Functions' could be more precisely referred to as 'methods' in an OOP context.
improvement.suggestion: We will take a simple example of a coffee machine. Think of the coffee machine as a class; it's like a blueprint that defines the methods of a coffee machine, such as making an espresso, making a cappuccino, or making a latte.

sentences.text: Now, when you buy a real coffee machine, it is like an object, right, it is by it and place on a table, like an object.

improvement.reason: The phrasing 'it is by it and place on a table' is grammatically awkward and unclear. It needs to clearly state that a real coffee machine is an instance of the class.
improvement.suggestion: Now, when you buy a real coffee machine, that physical machine is an object, an actual instance created from the class blueprint, which you can place on a table and use.

sentences.text: Now let us come to the Oops part of it. So the Oops has four different pillars, the first one is encapsulation.
Now, what is the capsule, it is the capsule, right, what is the capsule, it has some medicine inside and it is hidden by the outer capsule.

improvement.reason: The analogy is good, but it needs to explicitly connect the physical capsule to the programming concept of encapsulation, which involves bundling data and methods.
improvement.suggestion: Now, what is a capsule? Just like a medicine capsule has medicine inside, hidden by its outer shell, encapsulation in programming involves bundling data and the methods that operate on that data within a single unit, often an object, and hiding its internal details.

sentences.text: Now in terms of the coffee machine, a coffee machine has some internal wiring, it has a heating element, it has a coffee grinder, it is all hidden under the outer casing.
Now this is encapsulation like bundling of data and hiding under the casing.

improvement.reason: The definition of encapsulation is incomplete. It mentions 'bundling of data' but misses the crucial aspect of bundling methods and controlling access to the internal state.
improvement.suggestion: This is encapsulation: bundling the internal data (like wiring and heating elements) and the methods that operate on them (like making coffee) together within a single unit, and often hiding the complex internal workings from the outside world while providing a controlled interface.

sentences.text: Now moving on to the next one, it is abstraction. Now it may seem like a big term but really isn't.

improvement.suggestion: Now suppose I want an espresso. How do you interact with the machine? You simply press a button, and it gives you an espresso.
